action.content: Turn 0

You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Write your plan for your next actions on the line below your action, starting with "Next actions:".
For example:
> open cupboard
Next actions: take orange, eat orange

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the book on the table, the plate on the table and the mop on the table.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a kitchen now. There are a plate, a cupboard and a counter. The plate is on the counter. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a hallway, a living room and a pantry here.

> open cupboard  
Next actions: check contents of cupboard, take any useful items  

Assuming the cupboard contains the book:  

> take book  
Next actions: take plate, go to living room  

> take plate  
Next actions: go to living room, place plate and book on table  

> go living room  
Next actions: place plate on table, place book on table  

If the table is in the living room:  

> place plate on table  
> place book on table  
Next actions: go to pantry or hallway to find mop  

> go pantry  
Next actions: take mop, return to living room  

> take mop  
Next actions: go to living room, place mop on table  

> go living room  
> place mop on table  
> done  

If the cupboard is empty or lacks the book/mop, adjust to search other rooms first.
